title: if you only could use 6 champions
body:
what will they be?
your favuorite 6 champs you don't wanna play without

i switch champions a lot so i don't know honestly, but at the moment i would say

hey

Because i hate tanks

And because if you ban one i got five more

*edit double posted*
Your THAT kind of person
Im not only unashamed, im proud of it

You really like angrily running at and jumping on people.

That is accurate yes. But no for real I find the concept of running around like a ballet dancer for 20 minutes only to then one shot everyone after 20 minutes stupid. I prefer straight up combat and macro :)

{{champion:37}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:83}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:111}} 

To be honest the first 3 are the ones I actively play, Sion and Naut I play occasionally. And whil I rarely play Lux i do love her.

I play Sona an absolutely massive amount more than any others (1 mil Sona mastery, ~50k on my second most)

Truth be told you could tell me I'm not allowed to play anyone other than Sona and I'd probably be fine. I would also have a really rough time were I never allowed to play Sona again.
how come you love sona so much? never tried her but looks like he has a plain gamestyle

> [{quoted}](name=Sir Prepuzius,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BAukAQT7,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-10-17T10:41:19.296+0000)
>
> how come you love sona so much? never tried her but looks like he has a plain gamestyle

Well, when I first started League I looked through the selection of champions. I knew I wanted to support, because I've never liked being the "star of the show" I always liked being the enabler, the one who made it all possible but never got the spotlight. 

So I looked for a support, and I saw a few familiar faces from fanart... Ahri, mage, that's a maybe to try. Jinx, marksman. Doesnt catch my interest...

Then I encountered Sona, and she's a support! Perfect! I looked up some about her and was delighted to see that she fulfilled the role of buffing her allies in various ways, and can heal and protect, and a game-changing ult was the cherry on top.

I tried her out and instantly fell in love with the kit, and pretty soon after fell in love with Sona as a character too. 

Sure she's not complex but she's never stopped being so much fun for me to play, and I dont even play her full AP or midlane!

You may not look like much, but when that teamfight comes around, you will land the ability that turns the game around.
{{champion:222}} {{champion:27}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:29}} {{champion:81}}

top: Yorick and Urgot
Mid: Veigar
Jg: Nunu and Braum
Sup: Braum
ADC: Urgot
braum jungle?? tell me more

i bought braum yesterday and i 'd like to go off meta with him
how do you build him?
what is the broken strat?
basically you build him bruiser and go q->aa all the way, jax like?
what do you think of leona jungle/top ?

Sorry for late response

Build Jungle Braum with {{item:1041}} {{item:2031}} first

Broken strat is to build {{item:1401}} OR {{item:1416}} and gank whenever ultimate is down

if you end up getting behind build {{item:1401}} into {{item:3047}}  and then just finish your build as quickly as possible with {{item:3001}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3383}} ( {{item:3107}} OR {{item:3075}} )

If you get ahead build {{item:3748}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3022}} {{item:3512}} {{item:3071}} and you can 1v1 any non-ADC in the game and win. You should place ZZrot portals in such a way that you can escape from enemies by using W on the voidling if a voidling were to pop up.

Your earlygame is booty but after level 6 you can pop off and 1v1 most meta junglers if you get the first hit in. Enemies have to escape fights and you don't have many ways to keep enemies from running. Your only way to stop dashes is with Ulti so always keep that in mind. It's better to live and have an ult CD rather than die and still have ult.


That's pretty much off-meta braum

{{champion:82}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:82}}

Soy el numero uno

{{champion:236}} {{champion:236}}{{champion:236}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:236}} 

                                           {{champion:99}}

{{champion:59}} Easily my favorite jungler. Can be a tank, assassin, or bruiser. Make craters all day long, for Demacia!

{{champion:14}} Can be played support, top, or jungle. His dynamic kit makes him always fun, win or lose, whether in meta or out. Can be built lethality or tank, with many viable items and playstyles. There's a special place in hell for whoever popularized int'ing Sion, though. 

{{champion:77}} Everybody's favorite fast man. King of duels, invades, and dragon control. Best champion with effectively only 3 abilities, if you're playing him right.

{{champion:202}} My favorite adc, four obvious reasons. He has a passive that completely changes how he plays compared to other marksmen. His abilities are incredibly fun when they hit. Move over Caitlyn, there's a new sniper in town!

{{champion:432}} Who knew jamming four random, hilariously fun abilities together into one champ could make such a powerhouse? So much utility, burst, and mobility packed into one wandering minstrel.

{{champion:63}}  My one Trick, mid or support,no shame.
{{champion:103}} Easy to play, people complain alot on her, but don'T abuse her still. Weird
{{champion:127}} Underrated, watch out that new passive
{{champion:89}} When your ADC is not a pussy, E = Die
{{champion:37}} {{champion:143}} Because sometimes supports gotta be the AP carry
